item.title: Junior Gender Expert
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Country Gender Profile

Objective

To conduct an overall gender analysis in order to provide an overview of the gender inequalities that persist in Zimbabwe and its causes, how it intersects with other inequalities, how it impacts on human rights and enjoyment and/or benefits produced by and access to development efforts as well as an understanding of the Government’s commitment and capacity to work on GEWE issues.

Specific objective

  • To collate the available information on the gender equality situation in Zimbabwe in order to produce a comprehensive country gender profile that will assist the EU Delegation (EUD) and EU Member States in identifying the most appropriate objectives to be tackled, from the three thematic priorities identified in the GAP in order to contribute to enhanced GEWE in Zimbabwe.
  • To inform the EUD and Member States' programming processes by providing practical recommendations on how to mainstream gender in the programmes being developed in the NIP focal areas of governance (justice, elections, peace building, culture), health, agriculture and natural resources management, as well as develop gender equality indicators for these focal areas.

Junior Gender Expert (20 working days) Qualifications and skills

  • University degree or equivalent with relevant work experience in Sociology, Development Studies, Gender studies or equivalent;
  • Good communication skills, both oral and written;
  • Computer literacy (minimum MS Word, Excel, Management Information Systems.

General professional experience

  • Minimum 3 years extensive experience in the context of gender and development and/ or as a consultant from both short and long-term assignments on gender related studies;
  • Extensive knowledge of the development context of Zimbabwe

Additional Team requirements

  • One of the experts must have expertise in participatory methods.
  • Experience in data analysis is a plus.

Working languages All experts must be fluent in oral and written English

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to CorinaMaria_Campian@dai.com

Appui sectoriel a la formulation des interventions de l'UE dans le domaine du secteur prive et de la concurrence

Appui sectoriel à la formulation des interventions de l'UE dans le domaine du secteur privé et de la concurrence, y compris PME et TPME au profit des institutions suivantes :

item.title: Voter Registration Expert
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
EEM Ghana 2016

*Objectives *

The Mission will be composed of two experts: one Team Leader/Electoral Expert, one Voter Registration Expert. The objectives of the Mission are the following:

  • Observe the electoral process in Ghana. In particular, the preparations of the electoral administration, notably analysis of the voter registration process, namely of the process of revision of the voter register due to start at the end of June 2016, the work in this respect of the Electoral Commission (EC) in light of the May 2016 Supreme Court of Ghana ruling on the status of the electoral roll.
  • Analyse the electoral process according to international standards for elections. Identify possible short and long term recommendations, as well as political messaging.

  • Provide EEAS GLOBAL.3 election division and FPI/EC services by end of the mission with an Executive Summary (8 pages max.) of the main findings of the mission. This should include:

  • Introduction

  • Political situation/developments since conclusion of the prior ExM

  • Legal framework

  • The election administration with a focus on the state of preparedness and stakeholder confidence

  • Voters registration (process and output), with emphasis on the voters register exhibition period

  • The political environment (e.g; campaign) at the time

  • Pre-election petitions

  • Election offences, if any

  • Civil society and observation

  • Short and long term key recommendations (max 20)

  • Recommendations for the activities of any future EU EOM.

  • Submit a final report of a maximum of 35 pages including the points listed above, to include an executive summary and full text. Following final de-briefing with Commission and EEAS services in Brussels incorporate additional comments into the draft report and provide Commission and EEAS services with a final version.

  • Keep EEAS GLOBAL.3 Election Division and EC/FPI as well as the EU Delegation updated on the main electoral events, including through periodic interim reporting as agreed, and presentations to the EU Delegation and Member States in Abuja.

  • Provide an archive of contacts and information to support any subsequent EU election observation activities.

  • Provide a brief internal report.

Voter Registration Expert

Qualifications and Skills

  • Advanced University degree in law, political science, international relations, public administration, statistics, computer science OR in absence of advanced University degree, relevant professional experience of at least 2 years in the area related to Lot 7 to be added to the required general professional experience.

General Professional Experience

  • At least 12 years in the field of voter registration, election administration or related to Lot 7.

  • Voters registration (process and output), with emphasis on the voters register exhibition period

  • The political environment (e.g; campaign) at the time

  • Pre-election petitions

  • Election offences, if any

  • Civil society and observation

  • Short and long term key recommendations (max 20)

  • Recommendations for the activities of any future EU EOM.

  • Submit a final report of a maximum of 35 pages including the points listed above, to include an executive summary and full text. Following final de-briefing with Commission and EEAS services in Brussels incorporate additional comments into the draft report and provide Commission and EEAS services with a final version.

  • Keep EEAS GLOBAL.3 Election Division and EC/FPI as well as the EU Delegation updated on the main electoral events, including through periodic interim reporting as agreed, and presentations to the EU Delegation and Member States in Abuja.

  • Provide an archive of contacts and information to support any subsequent EU election observation activities.

  • Provide a brief internal report.

Team Leader Electoral Expert (Category Senior)

Qualifications and Skills

  • Advanced University degree in law, political science, international relations or any other discipline relevant to the assignment, OR in absence of advanced University degree, relevant professional experience of at least 2 years in the area related to Lot 7 to be added to the required general professional experience.

*General Professional Experience *

  • Approximately 12 years of experience in the field of elections or related to Lot 7.

Specific Professional Experience

  • Approximately 7 years work experience in the field of electoral assistance and electoral observation and analysis, preferably as part of an EU Election Observation Mission or an EU Election Technical Assistance project, possibly including managing an electoral observation mission, drafting statements and reports;
  • Experience with universal and regional standards for elections. In this context the “Compendium of International Standards for Elections'” is an important background document;
  • Excellent understanding of the functioning of election management bodies;
  • Experience in political analysis;
  • Experience in representing and providing briefings;
  • Previous experience in the country and/or the region, of working in a post-conflict environment and good networks within the different sectors of society in order to be immediately operational is an asset. Experience in the specific field of legal analysis and elections and proficiency in legal electoral issues in developing countries would be considered assets.

Language skills

  • Excellent written and spoken skills in English.

In addition, the Team Leader will present the following profile:

  • Excellent communication and inter-personal skills;
  • Excellent report drafting skills;
  • Coordination and management skills and past experience of management in a similar assignment, preferably as Deputy Chief Observer in an Election observation mission or as Chief Technical Adviser in a technical assistance project;
  • Proven knowledge and field experience of EU policies and programmes in the area of human rights, democratisation and good governance;
  • Proven work experience in project implementation and budget management of international civilian missions, preferably as part of an EU Election Observation Mission or an EU Election Technical Assistance project is an asset;
  • Proven work experience of contractual and budgetary procedures of EU external action and related mechanisms is an asset.
  • Adaptability to a multicultural working environment.

item.title: Evaluation Experts
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Mid-term Evaluation INSC (2014-17)

The Instrument for Nuclear Safety Cooperation (INSC) evaluation, together with the other independent evaluations of each External Financing Instrument (EFI) and the Coherence Report, will be some of the sources of information to feed into the Mid Term Review Report (MTR) of the EFIs. The MTR is required by the Common Implementing Regulation (CIR) Article 17, by end December 2017.

In addition to generating information for the MTR Report, the INSC evaluation will also provide information for:

  • the impact assessment for the next generation of instruments.
  • the final evaluation of the external financing instruments 2014-2020.

The objective of the INSC evaluation is:

  • to provide the relevant external relations services of the European Union and the wider public with an independent assessment of the European Union’s EFIs, including complementarities/synergies between the given EFI and each of the other EFIs.
  • to inform the programming and implementation of the current EFIs, as well as the next generation of the EFIs.

Evaluation Experts

The evaluation team should have the following demonstrated experience and expertise:

  • Working knowledge of EU external action policies, and their implementation modalities;
  • Working knowledge of international cooperation and development agendas (including the international aid and development effectiveness agenda and principles, e.g. Global Partnership for effective development co-operation - Busan);
  • Working knowledge of EU external co-operation policy and development policy of Member States, and their aid modalities;
  • Implementation procedures of the INSC, CIR;
  • Compliance checking in the area of policy implementation;
  • Evaluation methods and techniques in general and, preferably, of evaluation in the thematic area of the instrument; in particular the team needs to demonstrate experience in analytical methods which can evaluate change, and which can evaluate contribution;
  • Quantitative and qualitative data collection and analysis;
  • The team leader should have excellent communication, team co-ordination, presentation and proven report writing and editing skills in English;
  • The evaluation team should have an excellent command of English – both spoken and written – and the ability to function in French.

Desirable: experience of corporate results reporting frameworks
